item.title: Try Internet Fax For Free
item.description: Even though constantly texting is the norm today, fax machines are still important, especially in business, where they’re used for contracts and other key documents. But that doesn’t mean you need a bunch of fax machines in your office. You can send and receive faxes online, wherever you are, with the right fax plan. Instead of a clunky fax machine, a fax service plan is much more practical. Fax machines can only send faxes and take up space, while a fax service plan lets you send and receive faxes digitally through email and an online account, using your computer or laptop.

item.title: Phone Toll-Free Service
item.description: In today’s competitive business landscape, making things easier for customers can give you a significant edge. Offering a toll-free number is a simple way to stand out, as it demonstrates value and eliminates a potential barrier for price-conscious customers. While the cost of a phone call may seem trivial, even small expenses can influence purchasing decisions, especially for budget-conscious businesses. Providing a toll-free number removes this obstacle and presents a customer-friendly image.

item.title: T-1 Digital Telephone Lines
item.description: Businesses with multiple phone lines might be leaving money on the table if they haven’t explored T-1 digital phone lines. Even businesses already using T1 service might be unaware of potential savings from newer options. Digital telephony emerged in the 1950s as phone companies sought efficient ways to handle large call volumes. Analog phone lines carried a single conversation per wire pair. While analog multiplexing (carrier telephony) allowed multiple calls on a single wire pair, it suffered from quality issues over long distances.

item.description: Business conference calls, especially those with screen sharing, can lead to significant cost savings compared to in-person meetings. item.title: 10x10 Mbps Ethernet Providers in Demand
item.description: By: John Shepler Many believe that 10 Mbps Ethernet is replacing traditional T1 lines, and for good reason. This article will explore why that is, how this technology works, and the steps to upgrade. Businesses have relied on T1 lines for decades due to their high reliability, guaranteed bandwidth of 1.5 Mbps, and symmetrical upload and download speeds. Prices have also decreased over time, and availability is now widespread. The main drawback of T1 lines is their limited bandwidth.

What Makes Fiber Superior to Copper?

item.title: 866 Toll Free Numbers
item.description: Everyone knows about 800 numbers; they were the original toll-free option. But did you know there are others, like 866? Is it truly toll-free? Yes, 866 is indeed toll-free. It functions identically to 800; the difference is simply in the prefix. Just like area codes (202 for Washington, DC, 302 for Delaware), these prefixes are assigned nationwide. This highlights a key difference: toll prefixes are location-specific (area codes), while toll-free prefixes are not.

item.title: Managed Hosting Service
item.description: When you have a website or online store, you’re already familiar with web hosting. But did you know there are different types of web hosting? One type you might not know about is managed hosting, which can be more reliable and affordable than trying to handle everything yourself. In the early days of the internet, businesses often set up their websites by getting server software and using one computer as the web host.

item.title: Is Mobility Killing Your Company?
item.description: Initially, only a few executives used company cell phones, which made sense for accessibility. However, this practice expanded to various levels of management, ultimately leading to company-issued smartphones for everyone. While this enhanced communication and response time, it resulted in a complex network of individual contracts and bills due to a phased implementation. Consequently, managing numerous contracts and potentially unused devices became a challenge. Instead of handling this burden, businesses can outsource wireless cost control to specialized companies.
